title: Ferries Act, 1878
description: Official consolidated text of Ferries Act, 1878 (XVII of 1878) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

II.–PUBLIC FERRIES

provisions.title: Section 5. Claims for compensation. Claims for compensation for any loss sustained by any person
provisions.content:
in consequence of a private ferry being taken possession of under section 4 shall be inquired into by
the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situate, or such officer as he appoints in this behalf,
and submitted for the consideration and orders of the 5[appropriate Government].

provisions.title: Section 6. Superintendence of public ferries. The immediate superintendence of every public ferry
provisions.content:
shall, except as provided in section 7 6[and section 7A], be vested in the Magistrate of the district in
which such ferry is situate, or in such other officer as the 5[appropriate Government] may, from time
to time, appoint by name or in virtue of his office in this behalf7,
and such Magistrate or officer shall, except when the tolls at such ferry are leased, make all
necessary arrangements for the supply of boats for such ferry, and for the collection of the authorised
tolls leviable thereat.

provisions.title: Section 7. Management may be vested in municipality. The 5[appropriate Government] may direct
provisions.content:
that any public ferry situate within the limits of a town be managed by the officer or public body
charged with the superintendence of the municipal arrangements of such town;

provisions.title: Section 9. Recovery of arrears from lessee. All arrears due by the lessee of the tolls of a public ferry
provisions.content:
on account of his lease may be recovered from the lessee or his surety (if any) by the Magistrate of the
district in which such ferry is situate as if they were arrears of land-revenue.

provisions.title: Section 10. Power to cancel lease. The 5[appropriate Government] may cancel the lease of the tolls of
provisions.content:
any public ferry on the expiration of six months’ notice in writing to the lessee of its intention to cancel
such lease.
When any lease is cancelled under this section, the Magistrate of the district in which such
ferry is situate shall pay to the lessee such compensation as such Magistrate may, with the previous
sanction of the 5[appropriate Government], award.

provisions.title: Section 11. Surrender of lease. The lessee of the tolls of a public ferry may surrender his lease on the
provisions.content:
expiration of one month’s notice in writing to the 5[appropriate Government] of his intention to
surrender such lease, and on payment to the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situate of
such compensation as such Magistrate, subject to the approval of the 4Commissioner, may in each case
direct.

notification in the official Gazette, reduce or increase the said distance of two miles to such extent as
it thinks fit:

provisions.title: Section 14. Person using approaches, etc., liable to pay toll. Whoever uses the approach to, or
provisions.content: landing-place of, a public ferry is liable to pay the toll payable for crossing such ferry.

provisions.title: Section 15. Tolls. 3Tolls, according to such rates as are, from time to time, fixed by the 1[appropriate
provisions.content:
Government], shall be levied on all persons, animals, vehicles and other things crossing any river by a
public ferry and not employed or transmitted on the public service:
Provided that the 1[appropriate Government] may, from time to time, declare that any persons,
animals, vehicles or other things shall be exempt from payment of such tolls. Where the tolls of a ferry
have been let under section 8, any such declaration, if made after the date of the 4[lease], shall entitle
the lessee to such abatement of the rent payable in respect of the tolls as may be fixed by the
5
Commissioner of the division or such other officer as the 1[appropriate Government] may, from time
to time, appoint in this behalf by name or in virtue of his office.

provisions.title: Section 16. Table of tolls. The lessee or other person authorised to collect the tolls of any public ferry
provisions.content:
shall affix a table of such tolls, legibly written or printed in the vernacular language and, also if the
5
Commissioner of the division so directs, in English in some conspicuous place near the ferry,
List of tolls. and shall be bound to produce, on demand, a list of the tolls, signed by the
Magistrate of the district or such other officer as he appoints in this behalf.
6
[17. Tolls, rents, compensation and fines are to form part of revenues of Province. All
tolls, rents, compensation and fines under this Act (other than tolls received by any lessee) shall form
part of the revenues of the 7[Federation of the Province, as the case may be].

provisions.title: Section 18. Compounding for tolls. The 1[appropriate Government] may, if it thinks fit, from time to
provisions.content:
time, fix rates at which any person may compound for the tolls payable for the use of a public ferry.
III.–PRIVATE FERRIES

provisions.title: Section 20. Tolls. The tolls charged at such ferries shall not exceed the highest rates for the time being
provisions.content:
fixed under section 15 for similar public ferries.
IV.–PENALTIES AND CRIMINAL PROCEDURE

provisions.title: Section 21. Penalty for breach of provisions as to table of tolls, list of tolls and return of traffic
provisions.content:
Every lessee or other person authorised to collect the tolls of a public ferry, who neglects to affix and
keep in good order and repair the table of tolls mentioned in section 16, or who willfully removes,
alters or defaces such table, or allows it to become illegible, or who fails to produce on demand the list
of the tolls mentioned in section 16, and every lessee who neglects to furnish any return required under
section 12, shall the punished with fine which may extend to fifty rupees.

provisions.title: Section 22. Penalty for taking unauthorized toll, and for causing delay. Every such lessee or other
provisions.content:
person as aforesaid and any person in possession of a private ferry asking or taking more than the
lawful toll, or without due cause delaying any person, animal, vehicle or other thing, shall be punished
with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees.

provisions.title: Section 23. Penalty for breach of rule made under sections 12 and 19. Every person breaking any
provisions.content:
rule made under section 12 or section 19 shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may
extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

provisions.title: Section 24. Cancelment of lease on default or breach of rules. When any lessee of the tolls of a
provisions.content:
public ferry makes default in the payment of the rent payable in respect of such tolls, or has been
convicted of an offence under section 23, or, having been convicted of an offence under section 21 or
section 22, is again convicted of an offence under either of those sections, the Magistrate of the district
may, with the sanction of the 1Commissioner of the division, cancel the lease of the tolls of such ferry,
and make other arrangements for its management during the whole or any part of the term for which
the tolls were let.

provisions.title: Section 25. Penalties on passengers offending. Every person crossing by any public ferry, or using
provisions.content:
the approach to, or landing place thereof, who refuse to pay the proper toll, and every person-
who, with intent to avoid payment of such toll, fraudulently or forcibly crosses by any such
ferry without paying the toll, or
who obstructs any toll-collector or lessee of the tolls of a public ferry or any of his assistants
in any way in the execution of their duty under this Act, or
who, after being warned by any such toll-collector, lessee or assistant not to do so, goes or
takes any animals, vehicles or other things into any ferry-boat, or upon any bridge at such a ferry,
which is in such a state or so loaded as to endanger human life or property, or
who refuses or neglects to leave, or remove any animals, vehicles or goods from , any such
ferry-boat or bridge, on being requested by such toll-collector, lessee or assistant to do so,
shall be punished with fine which may extend to fifty rupees.
1

1[26. Penalty for maintaining private ferry within prohibited limits. Whoever establishes,

which may extend to five hundred rupees, and with a further fine which may extend to one hundred
rupees for every day during which the ferry is maintained or worked in contravention of those
provisions.]

provisions.title: Section 27. Fines payable to lessee. Where the tolls of any public ferry have been let under the
provisions.content:
provisions herein before contained, the whole or any portion of any fine realised under section 25 or
section 26 may, notwithstanding anything contained in section 17, be at the discretion of the convicting
Magistrate or Bench of Magistrates, paid to the lessee.

provisions.title: Section 28. Penalty for rash navigation and stacking of timber. Whoever navigates, anchors, moors
provisions.content:
or fastens any vessel or raft, or stacks any timber in a manner so rash or negligent as to damage a public
ferry shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine
which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both; and the toll-collector or lessee of the tolls of
such ferry, or any of his assistants, may seize and detain such vessel, raft or timber pending the inquiry
and assessment hereinafter mentioned.

provisions.title: Section 29. Power to arrest without warrant. The police may arrest without warrant any person
provisions.content: committing an offence against section 25 or section 28.

provisions.title: Section 30. Power to try summarily. Any Magistrate or Bench of Magistrates having summary
provisions.content:
jurisdiction under Chapter 2[XXII of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898)], may try
any offence against this Act in manner provided by that Chapter.

provisions.title: Section 31. Magistrate may assess damage done by offender. Every Magistrate or Bench of
provisions.content:
Magistrates trying any offence under this Act may inquire into and assess the value of the damage (if
any ) done or caused by the offender to the ferry concerned, and shall order the amount of such value
to be paid by him in addition to any fine imposed upon him under this Act; and the amount so ordered
to be paid shall be leviable as if it were a fine, or, when the offence is one under section 28, by the sale
of the vessel, raft or timber causing the damage and of anything found in or upon such vessel or raft.
The 3Commissioner of the division may, on the appeal of any person deeming himself
aggrieved by an order under this section, reduce or remit the amount payable under such order.
V.-MISCELLANEOUS

provisions.title: Section 32. Power to take possession of boats, etc., on surrender or cancellation of lease. When the
provisions.content:
lease of the tolls of any ferry is surrendered under section 11 or cancelled under section 24, the
Magistrate of the district may take possession of all boats and their equipment and all other material
and appliances used by the lessee for the purposes of such ferry, and use the same (paying such
compensation for the use thereof as the 4[appropriate Government] may in each case direct) until such
Magistrate can conveniently procure proper substitutes therefor.

provisions.title: Section 33. Similar power in cases of emergency
provisions.content:
When any boats or their equipment or any
materials or appliances suitable for setting up a ferry, are emergently required for facilitating the
transport of officers, or troops of l[Pakistan] on duty, or of any other persons on the business of
l
[Government], or of any animals, vehicles or baggage belonging to such officers, troops or persons or
of any property of l[Government], the Magistrate of the district may take possession of and use the
same (paying such compensation for the use thereof as 2[the 3[Federal Government], where the
transport is in connection with the affairs of the 3[Federal Government] and the Provincial Government
in other cases], may in each case direct) until such transport is completed.

provisions.title: Section 34. Jurisdiction of Civil Courts barred.–No suit to ascertain the amount of any compensation
provisions.content: payable, or abatement of rent allowable, under this Act shall be cognizable by any Civil Court.

provisions.title: Section 35. Delegation of Powers.–The 4[appropriate Government] may, from time to time, delegate,
provisions.content:
under such restrictions as it thinks fit, any of the powers conferred on it by this Act to any
5
Commissioner of a division or Magistrate of a district, or to such other officer as it thinks fit, by name
or by virtue of his office.
